greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Continued fraction for Product_{k >= 1} (1-1/2^k) (Cf. A048651).
comment: Continued fraction expansion of the constant Product{k>=1} (1-1/2^k)^(-1) = 3.46274661945506361... (A065446) gives essentially the same sequence.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge, 2003, pp. 354-361.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
Steven R. Finch, Minkowski's Question Mark Function [Broken link]
Steven R. Finch, Minkowski's Question Mark Function [From the Wayback machine]
Index entries for continued fractions for constants
program: (PARI) { allocatemem(932245000); default(realprecision, 21000); x=prodinf(k=1, -1/2^k, 1); z=contfrac(x); for (n=1, 20001, write("b048652.txt", n-1, " ", z[n])); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, May 07 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: Deleted old PARI program. - _Harry J. Smith_, May 20 2009
